tweets.text: Disturbed that in 2020 to see a high level of 59 sewage discharge into the @RiverChess but concerned that the @EnvAgency may be under reporting the figures. In addition the Environment Agency seemed to have forgotten to mention that 52 of these spills were un-permitted.

We’re at the end of the peatland restoration season. Recently we have been working to improve water quality and biodiversity on Shap Fells in Cumbria - here's our team in action
 @cumbriawildlife @unitedutilities @EnvAgency https://t.co/GSxdN7fZCY

Our Kent's Magnificent Moths project starts today😀 Working with organisations like @NaturalEngland @Natures_Voice & @EnvAgency this project supported by @HeritageFundUK will help to save some of the UK's rarest and most special moths #mothsmatter @savebutterflies @BCKentBranch https://t.co/H6ukA3tZez

The eggy smell is surrounding Walleys Quarry landfill in Silverdale. 

@PHE_uk says air quality monitoring near the site found levels of Hydrogen Sulphide exceeded World Health Organisation levels over 24hr period on 7-8th March. https://t.co/WKJQL4teoY

🌱Brilliant Buffers! The #TRRP team have been busy planting trees along a stream on a dairy farm. This 'buffer' strip will help intercept runoff and fencing will stop livestock accessing the stream, which was heavily poached by cattle. #SaveDevonsTrees Thanks to @EnvAgency #WEG https://t.co/4I8L4DWZxI

urls.title: ITV Central News: 'Crisis' in the water as river phosphate levels threaten wildlife on the Wye

tweets.text: Officers are attending the scene of a fire at a scrap metal yard in Sheffield, working with @SYFR to manage the risk of pollution from water used to fight the blaze. This includes dye-testing local drains, which may lead to a harmless discolouration to nearby watercourses. https://t.co/EB4mJUxLuA

@GrahamPark15 @EnvAgency @LancasterCC @VolkerStevinUK River Lune cycle path
Stretches from Morecambe to Caton

Six fire engines are still at the large fire on Carlisle Street in #Sheffield.

Firefighters are working with partner organisations @SheffCouncil, @EnvAgencyYNE to bring the fire under control.

People are advised to keep doors and windows closed if there is smoke in their area. https://t.co/Jhn8vd28Lh

'We understand people's concerns' - @StaffordshireCC Director of Care and Health speaks about odours in west Newcastle and further afield   https://t.co/GLJNln8sQm  @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids https://t.co/OZBQMhEJM1

Double spreader ⁦@CIWEM⁩ magasine about the River Severn partnership led by ⁦@EnvAgency⁩ and ⁦@ShropCouncil⁩. Massive picture of #worcester city. I’d like to know why ⁦@worcscc⁩ is not part of it???? 🧐 https://t.co/RwaX85DjQ4
Few more pics of our patrol yesterday evening @EnvAgencySE #fishing #angling #rivers https://t.co/W288lbzCjO
@PJennings88 @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK You will need to send a request to the water company. The @EnvAgency doesn't hold the raw discharge data, only the annual summary that was published yesterday.

@ChrisBaingerEA @SEGandrewK @EnvAgencyMids @robleedavies @severnrivers These we’re farmed for 6 months after being caught as elvers they would probably take 5 years to reach this size in the wild https://t.co/4gJgxGqW3n
@SEGandrewK @EnvAgencyMids @robleedavies @severnrivers Yes nicely pointed out. These were on the Gloucester Cam at Cambridge.
A few more photos of yesterday’s evening patrol along the River Thames, Oxford #angling #fishing #river @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/b7NrI71EAH

Very strong smell of slurry coming from the river in the middle of town today. #Frome Reported to the @EnvAgencySW . So long as there is slurry being produced and poured onto land rivers don't have a friggin chance. @RiverActionUK @GeorgeMonbiot @rivercide_live https://t.co/8EVFfOova3

urls.title: 'Flood busting' leaky dams installed on Crompton Moor
urls.description: Innovative flood risk management techniques have taken another step forward on Crompton Moor in Oldham with the...

tweets.text:
Have you seen that 5 ‘leaky’ dams have been built by @CityofTreesMcr to slow the flow of water at Crompton Moor in Oldham?

Constructed from tree trunks, these structures are able to hold back water during heavy rainfall events 💦

https://t.co/YjBJXEbZx4 https://t.co/mlspNgPs0K

Irresistible.
Newly tarmacced cycle track and river defence.
Superb job @EnvAgency @LancasterCC @VolkerStevinUK https://t.co/cSPFBVWXI6

@Penmcgregor We shouldn't be policing #HS2 Penny. They were granted a social licence to build this rail but it's obvious now that it was based on empty promises. @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency  should be keeping them in check yet they are sanctioning the destruction. Time to have our say!

tweets.text: Statement from @StaffordshireCC Director of Care and Health on implications of odours in west Newcastle and further afield.  https://t.co/GLJNln8sQm  @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids https://t.co/jjil0Zeulc

Self-reporting by water companies = abject failure and river habitats are paying the price. It’s time for the @EnvAgency to carry out its regulatory duties to the full. Every sewage spill increases profit - the system was destined to fail @Dunne4Ludlow https://t.co/0BMh4zjZDz

tweets.text:
#GoodFriday #Fish fantastic video of #BrookLamprey spawning
Filmed by #Herefordshire farmer Tony Norman a leading ambassador for the protection and improvement of our rivers in the #Wye catchment. 
#SpawningWatch 
@WUFoundation @theriverstrust @RiverFishUk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/0jtpX2nKyd

How many face coverings did you see littered on your last beach walk?

Litter spoils the places we enjoy and can make its way into the sea and possibly harm marine life.

Bring a bag for your #litter when you go outdoors and take it home to dispose of.

#BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/5XocwdLO82

tweets.text: This is a very good point. When the gas comes overnight it becomes trapped in the home & we breathe it in all night. It’s still outside in the morning so can’t release it. Could our homes have higher levels of hydrogen sulphide than outside @DrMickSalt ? @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency https://t.co/eRjR7yZnmt

How embarrassing that @RedIndustries2 has maintain for months that there is no smell - for a company that says it engages with the public & has a community spirit you have a funny way of showing it. Local people are furious & we are not going away @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency https://t.co/w6f3xzev9X

@1970Jdk @StinkStopthe @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL Please please keep reporting, if you don’t want to phone it’s 2 mins on an email. If we give up we are sentencing ourselves to this for life

So @EnvAgencyMids it took a whopping 13 days of monitoring to discover the WHO 24hr H2S limit is being breached and exceeded by a full 3rd by the gas from #WalleysQuarry. When do we get to see the rest of the data? How often is it breaching the "annoyance" limit? @StinkStopthe

Eely good news with river temperatures picking up towards 12°C #Eels are on the move.
These were caught as part of the monitoring at one of our gauging station pumped passes in #Gloucestershire - looks like it’s working 👍🏻  @SEGandrewK @EnvAgencyMids @robleedavies @severnrivers https://t.co/e2gjRx37Gv
We've reduces our attendance from 6 to 4 fire engines this morning, but also have a High Volume Pump on the scene which means several roads are closed https://t.co/Ub3m8eYjV5

Moving into the Himalayan balsam season, we’re delighted to launch a new project, in partnership with the @NorfolkNNSI & funded by @AnglianWater, to #bashbalsam in the Wensum catchment #invasivespecies 

Visit our page to find out more & report sightings: https://t.co/lC7m3uL96r https://t.co/hcnFILoTnD

@EnvAgency 25 years old, what a legacy.

“England’s rivers have become nothing more than an extension of the sewage system, polluted, poisoned and exploited for profit." https://t.co/NYtYA46c3g

And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz
@rivercide_live @EnvAgencySW @RiverActionUK @GeorgeMonbiot @EnvAgency They did.  This time no slug of slurry was detected. Just the same old filthy river.
@suesustainable @EnvAgencySW @RiverActionUK @GeorgeMonbiot Horrendous Sue. The @EnvAgency ought to be attending and testing. Please let us know if they do or don’t!
@ChrisBaingerEA @EnvAgencyMids @robleedavies @severnrivers Perhaps secondary migration of last year's arrivals? Good sign.

This is happening even without the impact of EDF Sizewell C's 10+ metres sea wall. No wonder Suffolk residents are alarmed EDF won't disclose design of sea wall & EDF believe it's ok to only protect their own site disregarding impact on neighbours 
@PINSgov @EnvAgency @The_ONR https://t.co/FX6CvLkfu7

tweets.text: @AaronBell4NUL @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL , I am truly aghast. I was certain that the odour nuisance guideline would be exceeded, but to hear that the health-based guidance is exceeded is truly astonishing. To think the residents of Newcastle were vilified for daring to complain, yet science backs them.

This ITV report is as shocking as yesterday’s news from the @EnvAgency . This is the death of an iconic river in slow motion - largely due to unmitigated agricultural pollution. The intensive poultry industry needs to clean itself up ASAP for starters @thenoblefoods https://t.co/d1pmbc1Fug

Cases of extreme odour plumes continue to occur on a daily basis effecting a large area of Newcastle. I would like to see @PHE_uk urgently look at the accumulative impact on health. @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/o5e4rbuvDi

Our latest update to the situation at #WalleysQuarry landfill site is now live.

Read it here 👉 https://t.co/o558iAVicn

#Silverdale #NewcastleUnderLyme https://t.co/NAyB7BIXU0

tweets.text:
Protecting #Swindon from flooding... Not raining now, but if we leave debris where it is, the natural flow of the stream could be affected... 

Maybe do some prep on how to avoid flooding, wherever you are... Some great advice on our website: https://t.co/64gyL62UXF
#floodaware https://t.co/0lV98vkHKl

@MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe Risk to health, we need to be moved out to somewhere we won't be poisoned Whalleys Quarry & it needs to happen now, can't stand another night like last night. #stopthestink
@annjsmall @StinkStopthe @Sian29337182 @WendyMa48697963 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 @PersimmonHomes How about Acrid Avenue

@RiverActionUK @EnvAgency @itvnews @watsonchas @thenoblefoods The response from @EnvAgency to the death of the Wye in the ITV story is pitiful. “EA warned that any breach of regulations found would be investigated, with enforcement action possible.” You have done NOTHING for years while farmers have killed the river.

@Sian29337182 @WendyMa48697963 @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 @PersimmonHomes Whoever sold them the land must be laughing, it's worthless & no one will buy there, can't sell a mile away, Keele University students don't be fooled into thinking the Hamptons new build is stink free #WhalleysQuarry #stopthestink
